item.title: Kafka
item.description: Kafka Kafka is fast. A single node can handle hundreds of read/writes from thousands of clients in real time. Kafka is also distributed and scalable. It creates and takes down nodes in an elastic manner, without incurring any downtime. Data streams are split into partitions and spread over different brokers for capability and redundancy. History of Kafka The result was a publish/subscribe messaging system that had an interface typical of messaging systems but a storage layer more like a log-aggregation system.
